SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc12
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Network

Interface VirtualServer

All Known Subinterfaces:
RMIVirtualServer
All Known Implementing Classes:
RMIServerStub, SocketClient, SocketServerHandler
public interface VirtualServer
The VirtualServer interface represents a server entity in a networked environment, providing a contract for communication between the server and clients.

This interface abstracts the communication protocol and network infrastructure, allowing client-side components to interact with servers without being tightly coupled to specific implementation details.

Implementations of this interface are expected to encapsulate the details of establishing and managing communication with servers, including low-level networking operations.

The commands exchanged between the client and server follow a predefined structure, as defined by the ServerCommand interface.

See Also:
  • for a standard structure of commands exchanged over the network.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    close()
    Closes the communication channel with the server.
    void
    requestToServer(ServerCommand command)
    Sends a command from a client to the server.

  • Method Details

    • requestToServer

      void requestToServer(ServerCommand command) throws Exception
      Sends a command from a client to the server.

      Implementations of this method should encapsulate the details of how the command is sent over the network, for example through Serialization, and any necessary error handling mechanisms.

      Parameters:
      command - The command to be sent to the server.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during communication with the server.

    • close

      void close() throws Exception
      Closes the communication channel with the server.

      Implementations of this method should encapsulate the details of how the communication channel is closed, such as releasing resources and terminating connections.

      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs while closing the communication channel.
